com.liferay.apio.architect.functional

Class Try<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.liferay.apio.architect.functional.Try<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the possible value type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Try.Failure, Try.Success

    @ConsumerType
public abstract class Try<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements the monadic Try type. This class's instances represent the result of an operation that either succeeds with type T or fails with an exception. Only two descendants of this class are allowed: Try.Success for the success case, and Try.Failure for the failure case. Never instantiate this class directly. If you're unsure whether the operation will succeed, use fromFallible(ThrowableSupplier) to create an instance of this class. To create a Failure instance directly from an exception, use fail(Exception). To create a Success instance directly from T, use success(Object).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Try.Failure<T>
      The implementation of Try'S failure case.
      static class  Try.Success<T>
      The implementation of Try'S success case.

    • Method Detail

      • fail

        public static <T> Try<T> fail(java.lang.Exception exception)
        Creates a new Try instance from an exception. This method creates the instance as a Failure object.
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception to create the Failure from
        Returns:
        the Try instance created from the exception

      • fromFallible

        public static <T> Try<T> fromFallible(ThrowableSupplier<T> throwableSupplier)
        Creates a new Try instance by executing a fallible lambda in a ThrowableSupplier. If this throws an exception, a Failure instance is created. Otherwise, a Success instance with the lambda'S result is created.
        Parameters:
        throwableSupplier - the throwable supplier that contains the fallible lambda
        Returns:
        Failure if the throwable supplier throws an exception; Success otherwise

      • fromFallibleWithResources

        public static <T,S extends java.io.Closeable> Try<T> fromFallibleWithResources(ThrowableSupplier<S> throwableSupplier,
                                                                               ThrowableFunction<S,T> throwableFunction)
        Creates a new Try instance by composing two functions: throwableSupplier and throwableFunction. The result of throwableSupplier is passed as the only parameter to throwableFunction. If either function fails, a Failure instance is returned. Otherwise, a Success instance with the results of throwableFunction is returned.
        Parameters:
        throwableFunction - the function to execute with the results of throwableSupplier
        Returns:
        a Success instance if the functions succeed; a Failure instance otherwise

      • fromOptional

        public static <T> Try<T> fromOptional(ThrowableSupplier<java.util.Optional<T>> throwableSupplier,
                                      java.util.function.Supplier<? extends java.lang.Exception> supplier)
        Creates a new Try instance by executing a fallible lambda that returns an Optional in a ThrowableSupplier. If this throws an exception, a Failure instance is created. If the returned Optional is empty, a Failure containing the exception supplier's value is returned. Otherwise, a Success instance with the lambda's Optional result is created.
        Parameters:
        throwableSupplier - the throwable supplier that contains the fallible lambda that returns an Optional
        supplier - the supplier for the exception if the obtained Optional is Optional#empty()
        Returns:
        Failure if the throwable supplier throws an exception, or the Optional is empty; Success otherwise

      • success

        public static <T> Try<T> success(T t)
        Creates a new Try instance from an object. This method creates the instance as a Success object.
        Parameters:
        t - the object to create the Success object from
        Returns:
        the Success object

      • filter

        public abstract Try<T> filter(java.util.function.Predicate<T> predicate)
        Returns a Try instance with a value, if that value matches the predicate. Otherwise, this method returns a Try instance with an exception that indicates the false predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate to apply to a value
        Returns:
        a Try instance with a value, if that value matches the predicate; otherwise a Try instance with an exception for a {@code false} predicate

      • flatMap

        public abstract <S> Try<S> flatMap(ThrowableFunction<? super T,Try<S>> function)
        Returns the result of applying the mapping function to the Success instance'S value, if the current Try instance is a Success; otherwise returns the Failure instance.

        This method is similar to map(ThrowableFunction), but the mapping function'S result is already a Try, and if invoked, flatMap doesn't wrap it in an additional Try.

        Parameters:
        function - the mapping function
        Returns:
        the result of the mapping function if applied to the Success instance'S value; the Failure instance otherwise

      • fold

        public abstract <S> S fold(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Exception,S> failureFunction,
                           ThrowableFunction<T,S> successFunction)
        Returns the value that results from applying failureFunction if this is a Failure, or successFunction if this is a Success.

        If successFunction throws an Exception, this method returns the result of applying failureFunction to the new Exception.

        Parameters:
        failureFunction - the function to apply when this Try is a Failure
        successFunction - the function to apply when this Try is a Success
        Returns:
        the value that results from applying the corresponding function

      • get

        public abstract T get()
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns a Success instance'S value, or a Failure instance'S exception. What this method returns therefore depends on whether the current Try instance is a Success or Failure.
        Returns:
        a Success instance'S value; otherwise the Failure instance'S exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the operation failed

      • getUnchecked

        public abstract T getUnchecked()
        Returns a Success instance'S value, or a Failure instance'S exception wrapped in a RuntimeException. What this method returns therefore depends on whether the current Try instance is a Success or Failure.
        Returns:
        a Success instance'S value; otherwise the Failure instance'S exception wrapped in a RuntimeException

      • ifFailure

        public abstract void ifFailure(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> consumer)
        Calls the provided consumer if the current Try instance is a Failure; otherwise nothing occurs.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer

      • ifSuccess

        public abstract void ifSuccess(java.util.function.Consumer<T> consumer)
        Calls the provided consumer if the current Try instance is a Success; otherwise nothing occurs.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the consumer

      • isFailure

        public abstract boolean isFailure()
        Returns true if the current Try instance is a Failure; otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the current Try instance is a Failure; false otherwise.

      • isSuccess

        public abstract boolean isSuccess()
        Returns true if the current Try instance is a Success; otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the current Try instance is a Success; false otherwise.

      • map

        public abstract <S> Try<S> map(ThrowableFunction<? super T,? extends S> throwableFunction)
        Returns the result of applying the mapping function to the Success instance'S value, if the current Try instance is a Success; otherwise returns the Failure instance.

        This function is similar to flatMap(ThrowableFunction), but the mapping function'S result isn't a Try, and if invoked, map wraps it in Try.

        Parameters:
        throwableFunction - the mapping function
        Returns:
        the result of the mapping function if applied to the Success instance'S value; the Failure instance otherwise

      • mapFail

        public abstract <S extends java.lang.Exception> Try<T> mapFail(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Exception,S> function)
        Returns a Try instance that contains the result of applying the mapping function to the current Try instance'S exception, if that instance is a Failure object. If the current Try instance is a Success object, this method returns it unmodified.
        Parameters:
        function - the mapping function to apply to the Failure instance'S exception
        Returns:
        the Try with the mapping function'S result; the Success object otherwise

      • mapFailMatching

        public abstract <S extends java.lang.Exception,U extends java.lang.Exception> Try<T> mapFailMatching(java.lang.Class<U> exceptionClass,
                                                                                                     java.util.function.Supplier<S> supplier)
        Returns a Try instance that contains the exception provided by the Supplier, if the current Try instance is a Failure object whose exception class matches that of the exceptionClass parameter. If the current Try instance is a Success object, this method returns it unmodified.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier
        Returns:
        the Try with the exception from the supplier; the Success object otherwise

      • mapOptional

        public <S> Try<S> mapOptional(ThrowableFunction<? super T,? extends java.util.Optional<S>> throwableFunction)
        Returns the result of applying the mapping function to the Success instance's value and unwrapping the resulting Optional, if the current Try instance is a Success and the Optional isn't Optional#empty(); otherwise returns the Failure.
        Parameters:
        throwableFunction - the mapping function
        Returns:
        the mapping function's result if the Success instance's value doesn't return Optional#empty(); the Failure instance otherwise

      • mapOptional

        public <S> Try<S> mapOptional(ThrowableFunction<? super T,? extends java.util.Optional<S>> throwableFunction,
                              java.util.function.Supplier<? extends java.lang.Exception> supplier)
        Returns the result of applying the mapping function to the Success instance's value and unwrapping the resulting Optional, if the current Try instance is a Success and the Optional isn't Optional#empty(); otherwise returns the Failure instance with the provided exception.
        Parameters:
        throwableFunction - the mapping function
        supplier - the exception's supplier in case the obtained Optional is Optional#empty()
        Returns:
        the mapping function's result if the Success instance's value doesn't return Optional#empty(); the Failure instance otherwise

      • orElse

        public abstract T orElse(T other)
        Returns the Success instance'S value, if the current Try instance is a Success object. If the current Try instance is a Failure object, this method returns the other parameter.
        Parameters:
        other - the value to return if current Try instance is a Failure object
        Returns:
        the Success instance'S value, or other

      • orElseGet

        public abstract T orElseGet(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends T> supplier)
        Returns the Success instance'S value, if the current Try instance is a Success object. If the current Try instance is a Failure object, this method returns the result of invoking Supplier#get().
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier
        Returns:
        the Success instance'S value, or the result of the supplier'S get method

      • orElseThrow

        public abstract <S extends java.lang.Throwable> T orElseThrow(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends S> supplier)
                                                       throws S extends java.lang.Throwable
        Returns the Success instance'S value, if the current Try instance is a Success object. If the current Try instance is a Failure object, this method throws the exception that results from invoking Supplier#get().
        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier
        Returns:
        the Success instance'S value
        Throws:
        S - if the current Try instance was a Failure object
        S extends java.lang.Throwable

      • recover

        public abstract T recover(java.util.function.Function<? super java.lang.Exception,T> function)
        Returns the result of applying the function to the Failure object'S exception, if the current Try instance is a Failure object. If the current Try instance is a Success object, this method returns that object'S value.
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        Returns:
        the function'S result when applied to the Failure; the Success object'S value otherwise

      • recoverWith

        public abstract Try<T> recoverWith(ThrowableFunction<? super java.lang.Exception,Try<T>> throwableFunction)
        Returns a new Try instance extracted from the provided function, if the current Try instance is a Failure object. If the current Try instance is a Success object, this method returns that object.
        Parameters:
        throwableFunction - the function
        Returns:
        the new Try instance, if the current Try instance is a Failure object; the current Success object otherwise

      • toOptional

        public abstract java.util.Optional<T> toOptional()
        Returns the current Try instance as an Optional containing the value if it's a Success or Optional#empty() if it's a Failure.
        Returns:
        an Optional containing the value if it's a Success; Optional#empty() otherwise

      • voidFold

        public abstract void voidFold(java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> failureConsumer,
                              ThrowableConsumer<T> successConsumer)
        Applies failureConsumer if the current Try instance is a Failure, or successConsumer if it's a Success.

        If successConsumer throws an Exception, this method returns the result of applying failureConsumer to the new Exception.

        Parameters:
        failureConsumer - the consumer to apply when this Try is a Failure
        successConsumer - the consumer to apply when this Try is a Success
